comment: Test heavy class 4 test and 75% of your grade but its not on lockdown & you do have to do it on a specific time on sunday

I was really disappointed in this class. I am a fully online student and this class was awful. He never responds to my emails, never gives any feedback on tests or quizzes, and does not give any lectures. The textbook he assigns is the most boring textbook I've ever read. I advise not to take his class.

He comes off as disinterested in teaching this course. Tests are on Sunday in the late evening, around 7:00 pm to 11:00 pm, but does not allow reschedules for any conflicts. His response is to reschedule my problem or drop the class. He provides no feedback for quizzes and tests so you won't know what was wrong. Little to no support in the class.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Not friendly at all and does not like to be asked questions. Had to teach myself everything, all he puts out are tests. Requires tests on SUNDAYS for small periods of time towards the end of the night which intervened heavily with family time. Weekends are not for EXAMS. Give us rest, and be kinder. Would not take this professor if I could go back.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: Awful. If you can, avoid getting into this mess. Forgets due dates and we never saw official grades until the whole semester was over. Extremely restricts taking notes, asking questions or making comments, you are barely allowed to breath. Such a disorganized class. Sad to say, it has been my worst experience in a class while doing my MBA in KSU.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy

comment: Tutterow was a solid professor. If you show up you will learn a lot of useful skills that translate into the real world. 2 tests, a handful of case studies. Case studies are graded on if you attempt them (Easy A) Mid term and Final can be difficult if you don't know how to do the case studies. He gives extra opportunities at the end of the semester
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Uncle Rog is awesome! Dont let the other reviews scare you. Hes funny and his lectures are amazing. I learned so much for him. I would take anything he teaches!! Downsides: gives assignments and tests last minute. It make it difficult to schedule around and there are not many items that are graded, so everything that is graded it worth a lot.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor is knowledgeable and loves the subject. The issue is the teaching goes beyond the subject requirement. For students without mathematical background or not having the undergraduate in the US, difficulty level skyrockets.  The class has not mandatory attendance but is a must and have to insist reaching him and not always is very friendly.
No lectures at all. I know it was an online class but literally nothing was ever posted except quizzes and test.

Does not explain things well and gets extremely frustrated when you do not understand. Does not use a textbook but should. Slow in responding to emails and getting texts returned to you. Class was extremely difficult.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Don't let the other ratings scare you. This professor teaches you exactly what you need to know in Finance and only tests you on material you go over in class. He applies everything to real world concepts which is extremely beneficial. The grades are pretty much only exams, but they are absolutely doable. Would love to take this teacher again!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Solid professor and solid guy. I came into it not knowing what to expect with his sub-par reviews, but Roger was great. We had class online due to COVID, but he provided ample resources to cement our learning. The content is difficult to grasp sometimes but if you put in the work youll do fine. Id take him again.
rating_tags: Respected--Amazing lectures--Get ready to read

comment: Two major issues: 1- Material on tests did not match the textbook. Frequently it was the same concepts but different terminology. It was clear he wasn't familiar with the book and there was no other instruction given (lectures, etc) 2-You NEVER learn what you got wrong on a test or quiz which makes it impossible to study or improve.
rating_tags: Test heavy

comment: This would be a tough class no matter who you take but I feel Professor Tutterow made it even harder. He refuses to let you see what you missed on any quizzes so you have no idea what you need to study for tests. If you email him you better have a back bone, he has no people skills and can be quite callous.
rating_tags: Graded by few things

comment: Your grade is 75% tests (3 tests) and 25% quizzes (11 quizzes) all done on d2l with no lockdown browser. I had problems with his professionalism as well as he will never show what you got wrong on quizzes/tests so you never know what to study. He made many mistakes on tests and made students work back the points from his mistakes. Hard but do-able.

There are very few assignments, 9 quizzes worth 30% of final grade and 2 tests each worth 35% of the final grade. They are hard which makes it very difficult to get a good grade in his class. Also, There were several issues with the grading system marking correct answers as wrong. I would suggest taking someone else.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Appears he did not like interaction with students. I developed the feeling he did not want to assist his students either. Some quizzes and test were posted online on the last day of deadline. No extra credit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: This is a tough course, regardless of who you take. Try and take someone else though, especially if you aren't good at completely learning everything on your own. I taught myself everything and it still didn't cut it. Complicated, unorganized and not understanding.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: This was a fairly easy class. Quiz every week with SATURDAY TESTS on a small time window... He says everything is laid out in the syllabus but it is not.. test times aren't on there so you don't know how to plan for the tests. Inconvenient, yes. Slightly harsh over email but that didn't matter to me. d2l tests and quizzes. Do them all.
rating_tags: Participation matters--TEST HEAVY

comment: He's RUDE(paranoid about GroupMe cheating) But the class is fine, weekly quizzes (open for days)drop lowest. 3 Exams on SATURDAYS. He opens them for only six hours, 25% of grade, each - on Saturdays. If you can't make it (online), he said drop. But they're easy quizlet tests, not hard. If you're good w Sat, and rude comments, he's easy.

Roger is not very polite, nor is he very patient. I would compare this class to learning from a small child. He could certainly use some work on his interaction with students, and he really does not appreciate it when he is misunderstood. However, if you work in Economics or are very strong in Excel, you can probably get by.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Tests are straight forward. He uses lecture slides from another professor that was awesome. Probably the only reason I did well. He has a VERY short fuse so don't expect any extra credit. I did well in the class but like I said, I listened to the narrated lectures from another professor.
Very sarcastic and easily frustrated if you don't understand him. He lectures more than he teaches and we didn't use the book at all.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The online class format is very difficult, especially overr the summer.  Tests are super hard and long discussion each week.  So much stuff to remember in only a few days.  No curve.  This class is a GPA dropper.  Avoid this professor.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Gives 3 test. They are pretty straightforward and easy if you just read and take notes in class. He is understanding. He rounds your grade up if the whole class in doing bad. Strict cell phone policy. Usually late to class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment: Dr. Tutterow made Econ great. Class was easy and straightforward. Put in a basic level of effort and you're set.  No phones! And beware of his sarcasm!  Attendance isn't mandatory but don't skip every class. At some point a little math is introduced and it helps on the exam to know exactly how to solve it. 3 exams, EC, and a generous curve. TAKE
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Tutterow is the man. Super easy tests.  He will yell at you very loudly for having your phone out, and then continue lecturing. Facebook addicts -- stay away!  Beware of his "free learning". That really means "20 minutes of interesting stuff that won't be on the test".   He makes lots of  80's pop culture references, so be ready for that.
Tests at online and not too hard,  take minimal notes and you will pass for sure. Class ends early November and there is no final! He has a great personality and is not boring at all.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Such a professional and intelligent guy but loves to draw graphs and makes taking notes a bit weird. Sometimes hard to understand. Strict phone policy for your own good. only graded by your tests, which were online and very difficult for an intro course. Would recommend him for a higher econ class but if you have to take him, go visit office hours
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: good teacher especially if math is not your strong suite. there were many times this teacher re-went over topics that he knew the class didn't understand. he welcomes questions  &  knows that sometimes the information can be confusing and its like he caters to the students  through teaching styles.

Just make sure you stay on top of things you should be fine. The test are a bit hard. The class was made up of 10 quizzes and two test the lowest two are dropped. Did not have an difficulties. Was always good about responding back on email. I would recommend taking this class than rather in class. It was a great online class. It was my first one!

Continuously late to class, took many breaks, which wasted our time waiting for him. When asked to clarify or for help he would direct you to other resources.  Went off tanget continously so students weren't clear about what was relevant to the course.

Tutterow is awful! He was usually about 30 min. late for class and took excessive breaks so we spent a lot of time waiting around for him. He didn't teach anything and wasn't interested in helping students understand the classwork or tests. We got our midterm grades the day of the final so our grades were a mystery all term.
